Package io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.util

Class ObjectFormatter

java.lang.Object
io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.util.ObjectFormatter
public final class ObjectFormatter extends Object
Utility class for formatting objects and their fields into various string representations.

Provides methods to format object fields, collections, arrays, generate HTML content from data, format annotations, process responses, and format journey data.

Author:

  • Method Details

    • formatObjectFields

      public static String formatObjectFields(Object obj)
      Formats the fields of the provided object into a string representation. Uses a set to detect circular references.
      Parameters:
      obj - the object whose fields will be formatted
      Returns:
      a formatted string representing the object's fields

    • generateHtmlContent

      public static String generateHtmlContent(Map<Enum<?>,List<Object>> arguments)
      Generates HTML content by loading an HTML template and replacing placeholders with formatted argument rows.
      Parameters:
      arguments - a map of Enum keys to LinkedList of objects representing arguments
      Returns:
      a string containing the generated HTML content

    • escapeHtml

      public static String escapeHtml(String input)
      Escapes HTML special characters in the provided input string.
      Parameters:
      input - the string to escape
      Returns:
      the escaped string suitable for HTML display

    • getClassAnnotations

      public static String getClassAnnotations(org.junit.jupiter.api.extension.ExtensionContext context)
      Retrieves and formats annotations present on the test class associated with the provided extension context.
      Parameters:
      context - the JUnit extension context containing test class information
      Returns:
      a string containing formatted class annotations or a message if none are found

    • formatProcessedData

      public static String formatProcessedData(JourneyData[] originalData, Object[] processedData)
      Formats processed journey data along with the corresponding original data into a readable string.
      Parameters:
      originalData - an array of JourneyData annotations associated with the data
      processedData - an array of processed data objects corresponding to the original data
      Returns:
      a formatted string representing the processed journey data
